name: Restoration of the Monarchy
description: After over forty years of American occupation and imperialism, the House of Kaw훮nanakoa is restored to the throne. The government may be still divided on how the family shall rule, but there is no American to remove the democratic process of decision-making.

name: Cultural Revival
description: Where the US government suppressed Hawaiian language and culture has failed. We will speak in our native tongue and enjoy the patronage of traditional art once more. American immigrants are free to enjoy their own culture in this new Kingdom as well.

name: Hawaiian Renaissance
description: With our language revived, the King has commissioned a translation of every work in the Honolulu Library into Hawaiian. This will surely participate another cultural renaissance.

name: Ponana Leo
description: With an emerging class of artists in our great culture, we must undo the damage done by the Missionary Schools. A P큰nana Leo, or Language Nest, is a grassroots response to the highly regulatory nature of education in Hawaii.

name: Kanawai Mamalahoe
description: Enshrined in the original 1797 Constitution is the edict, Let every elderly person, woman and child lie by the roadside in safety. Children, Elders, and the homeless will not suffer in abuse in the Kingdom.

name: Constitutional Monarchy
description: Although our 1797 Constitution has several modern appendages, it lacks some of the legalistic updates as the US Territory law took over.

name: A Devoted Monarchy
description: The House of Kaw훮nanakoa has spent the last few decades working towards an independent Hawaii. No matter what your political or religious beliefs are, the Monarchy is devoted to your happiness and wellbeing as Hawaiians.

name: Proportional Representation
description: The privy council has run Hawaii's legislation for decades on an appointment basis, which under the American rule was staffed by business interests and controlled almost exclusively by Republicans. We need to amend the latest 1893 Constitution with a proportional legislature.

name: Legacy of Kamehameha
description: The House of Kamehameha is the parent branch of the Kaw훮nanakoa, and we owe much debt to the King that united the islands.

name: Royal Projects
description: The King has ordered new facilities to be built on the Big Island in order to better present the majesty of the Kingdom to the wider world.

name: The People's King
description: At one time the young King was a Republican, seeing no way for his dynasty to recover their authority without the support of the people. Therefore, the King does not disparage the republicans, but instead hopes to exceed their expectations for a delegated and responsible ruler.

name: Hawaiian Home Land
description: Rampant unemployment following Black Monday has led to a rash of homelessness. Going above Kanawai Mamalahoe, we must utilize the royal builders to employ temporary labor to build housing for the poor.

name: Return Ceded Land
description: The land left behind by fleeing American businessmen has been left to their stewards. Now the land can be rightfully transferred in ownership to their proper owners. Be they the servants of the land, or the original owners before illegal seizure during the coup of 93.

name: Support the Kama'aina
description: In order to encourage local business growth after the end of the oligopoly, we have begun to offer the Kama'aina support. These native residents are the backbone of our political support.

name: Kuleana Rights
description: Responsibility to the land was neglected under the US occupation. Now the Kingdom inherits a debt of Kuleana, but we are proud to steward our land and take a direct role in the safety of our flora and fauna.

name: Ua Mau ke Ea o ka 'Aina i ka Pono
description: The old motto of our parent House of Kamehameha, the life of the land is perpetuated in righteousness. It is a call for wise rule over dictatorial powers of a king. Most importantly, it is the beneficent rule over one's own land.

name: Declare the Republic
description: In the turmoil of our new independence, we have chosen to preserve the democratic system of the old United States, albeit localized to just our islands. Liberty has prevailed!

name: Strengthen Democracy
description: Monarchists and radical Leftists seek to undermine our democracy from every angle. We should ensure that the unalienable right of democracy can never be taken away.

name: Political Meritocracy
description: The mainland fell into chaos in part due to cronyism and nepotism. We need to make sure our new republic is a true meritocracy, where anyone can succeed based on their intelligence and skills.

name: Promote Education
description: A functioning democracy is entirely dependent on a functioning education system. We need to ensure that the University of Hawaii and other educational institutions are able to provide for all, no matter their background.

name: Stable Republic
description: While elections might be exciting, they should also be stable. The 1936 Presidential election showed us the necessity of a well-ordered political process. We need to ensure that our democratic traditions are protected through both laws and norms.

name: Legacy of America
description: While the mainland might be far away, the legacy of democracy has left a lasting imprint on Hawaii. Divided branches of government, open and free elections, and individual liberty all need to be enshrined in our new constitution.

name: Republicanism
description: A direct democracy, even on the smile scale of Hawaii, will never work. We need to ensure our new government is republican in nature, in order to better protect our citizen's rights and freedoms.

name: Americanism
description: Americanism means capitalism, freedom, and liberty. We need to ensure these rights are protected for all our citizens, no matter their race or religion.

name: Civilizing Mission
description: Hawaii still has many areas untouched by modern civilisation, especially on the Big Island. We need to make sure all our citizens are brought up in the ways of Western education and culture.

name: Separation of Powers
description: The separation of powers needs to be enshrined in our constitution, otherwise we may fall to strongmen or mob rule. Independent courts will ensure that all laws that are passed are fair and equitable to all citizens.

name: Multicultural Republic
description: Beside native Hawaiians, we have large immigrant populations from China, Japan, the Philippines, and Portugal. We need to ensure these communities all work together for the greater good of Hawaii.

name: Support from the Big Five
description: The Big Five's interests are well-supported in our new republic, as the plantations are the lifeblood of our economy.

name: Plantation Support
description: Plantations employ most of our citizens outside of Honolulu. Through tax cuts and other legislation, we can ensure that they remain on our side and supportive of the new government.

name: Hawaiian Sugar Planters' Association
description: The HPSA represents the interests of the most powerful planters on the islands. We need to co-opt their support through whatever means are necessary in order to ensure the stability of our new republic.

name: Pacific Free Trade
description: We are a valuable entrepot in the thriving trade of the Pacific, and we should ensure that Canada, Japan, Australasia, and other nations know we are open for business.

name: Jewel of the Pacific
description: Hawaii remains a bastion of freedom and liberty in the Pacific. Immigrants from all around the globe flock to our shores, and our economy is booming. Long live Hawaii!

name: The Revolution Succeeds
description: The great Hawaiian Revolution is over, but unless something is done the wounds we have torn open in this land will continue to fester and bleed. We must work with haste to build up an egalitarian, equal and enduring Hawaii, from the ruins of the old.

name: Revolutionary Mahele
description: The first Great Mahele was when Kamehameha III to stop the illegal homesteading of the 1850.s We the people can outdo the king and even provide for our fellow American allies a home.

name: Destroy the Big Five
description: The Big Five Companies, through the Republican Party and the Privy Council, ha e ruled Hawaii for far too long. Their political repression and use of racial militias should be answered by expropriation of their assets on the islands.

name: Land Collectivisation
description: The State agriculture organisation is now grouped under the Commune's Agricultural Department, and is formed into trusts for individual crops and geographical divisions of the industry. Crops are sold either directly to the government, to the cooperatives, or, in a very rapidly lessening extent, upon the open local markets.

name: Revolutionary Welfare
description: Publicly funded healthcare was for a long time shunned in the Unitd States, as countless former presidents were beholden to the will of Big Business over their electorate. As we've now broken the yoke of corporations, public ownership has finally been legalized and enforced, and soon a prosperous Hawaiian welfare state will be created!

name: Communal Democracy
description: The new Hawaii cannot be built through authoritarian means, we must pursue a better class character for our democracy. Through laws empowering grassroots engagement and townhall meetings, political decisions will no longer be a distant murmur on Capitol Hill, they will be right amongst the workers!

name: People's Assemblies
description: Governing an entire chain of islands will be difficult. We need to set up autonomous people's assemblies on each island to better ensure our citizen's interests are represented and their complaints can be heard.

name: Industrial Democracy
description: For far too long, whatever fig leaf of democracy was left at the door as Hawaiians became slaves to petty tyrants in the Privy Council. The People's Assembly has mandated a new Industrial Democracy committee to promote cooperation between unions towards a democratic goal.

name: Unionisation
description: Labor unions must rise to become the dominant force within our economy, unions now empower every extent of the Commonwealth government.

name: Agricultural Unions
description: The Agricultural sector will be obliged to feed our nation, but other than that broad instruction, we can allow the farmers to operate mostly independently. Self-determination over forced collectivisation or quotas will bring about true socialism.

name: Worker's Cooperatives
description: We shall ensure that the work our laborers do will be of equal value to their efforts. The People's Council has passed laws to de-regulate equity and empower Contract Free Association.

name: Fight Reactionary Thought
description: In no country was culture so debased by capitalism as in Hawaii. Essentially a gigantic effort to perpetuate the robbery of the workers. The Proletarian revolution in Hawaii has at once made a slash into the maze of hypocrisy and intellectual rubbish, paving the road for a glorious new nation.

name: Female Emancipation
description: Women's suffrage has been assailed ever since the ascent of Queen Lili'uokalani, first by capitalists and then by reactionaries. We carve our way through both to provide the Hawaiian people true democracy in representation.

name: Education Reform
description: We must reform our Eurocentric and anti-modernist education system a compromise between either side. All school age children are required to attend, and both English and Hawaiian courses should be made available.

name: Ho'oponopono
description: That phrase means reconciliation and mental cleansing to us. We must push the public consciousness forward towards a bold median between tradition and westernism.

name: Hawaiian Socialism
description: Although our doctrine be based on mainland writings, our resolve and deep control of our social environment has allowed Hawaii to become a model socialist nation.

name: Pacific Trade
description: We do not have many natural resources, but our position in the Pacific means we are a hub for trade. We need to ensure we have adequate facilities to process the influx of trade that is sure to come.

name: Modernize the Islands
description: Many islands, especially the Big Island, lack infrastructure and any sort of manufacturing capability. While trade is good, we need to ensure we are at least somewhat self-sufficient.

name: Sugar Industry
description: Sugar is the lifeblood of our economy. We need to ensure plantations have enough infrastructure and support to survive the shocks of independence.

name: Support the Plantations
description: Coffee and banana plantations represent the other major components of our economy outside of sugar. We need to ensure they receive the same amount of support the sugar industry does.

name: Support Small Businesses
description: While large plantations are important for our industry, small businesses in Honolulu, Hilo, and other towns also need our support to survive the economic chaos independence brought.

name: Civilian Investments
description: A bold strategy has been devised by [Root.GetLeader] to assist in economic recovery. Traditional notions that government purchases are negatively associated with growth, newer theories hold that smart purchases can stimulate the economy.

name: Maritime Trade
description: While not nearly as historically significant as on the West Coast, we still have a strong legacy of commercial shipping. We should ensure that this industry supports the war effort.

name: Merchant Marine
description: The Merchant Marine was severely damaged in the struggle of 1936, [Root.GetLeader] has approved the extension of veteran benefits to those active duty sailors who are not on tour if they become members of the Merchant Marine in their downtime.

name: Foreign Economic Advisors
description: Japanese, Canadian, and Australasian economic advisers are all more than happy to help improve our economy. While we don't want to sign too much of our country away, assistance is needed.

name: Foreign Investments
description: Paradoxically, we need investment from outside Hawaii to become self-sufficient. New factories, roads, and ports all need to be constructed, and foreign countries are lining up to be a part of our new economy.

name: Bounty of Hawaii
description: We are rich in natural resources and produce. Hawaiian sugar and coffee are renowned around the world, and we should ensure that our resources make it to global markets.

name: Expand Ports
description: Our commodity export-focused economy requires us to constantly be expanding our ports in order to keep up with shipping demand. Already, requests for new harbours have been submitted. We need to start construction at once.

name: Electrification Effort
description: In order to accommodate the new infrastructural changes, as well as ensure the safety of the island against natural disasters, an electrification project is approved for all the inhabited islands.

name: Military Investments
description: The defence of Hawaii should not be neglected in our quest to achieve economic self-sufficiency. A small domestic military industry can employ many in Honolulu and also help equip our troops.

name: Thriving Economy
description: Against all odds, we have achieved economic self-sufficiency! Our citizens are employed, plantations are exporting record crop yields, and new roads and ports have made the islands closer integrated than ever before!

name: Assess the Navy
description: The Hawaiian Navy was heavily or entirely reliant on US support. With loyalists in Honolulu dedicated to protecting the Pacific above their orders to retreat to the mainland, we should work on improving our capabilities.

name: Coastal Defenses
description: Powerful coastal guns can help us defend from any enemy naval invasion, and destroy enemy ships before they get close to shore.

name: Modernize the Forts
description: A number of colonial forts still dot the islands, but they are old and crumbling. We should repair and modernize them, and ensure that they are able to withstand an attack from modern weaponry.

name: Military Research
description: We are having our best scientists and business leaders look into what we should invest our efforts into guns, artillery, tanks, our improving our own doctrines.

name: Support Brigades
description: The army has requested more support while traversing the trenches our enemies have erected.

name: Modern Guns
description: Our armaments are insufficient to break through modern lines. We need to invest in improving our arms in order to close the gap with other nations.

name: Defend the Islands
description: These islands are our homeland. We need to defend them at all cost against those who seek to destroy our history and way of life.

name: Ha'iku Radio Station
description: A top secret facility in the mountains of O'ahu, the Ha'iku radio station will allow us to monitor radio traffic across the Pacific, giving us a significant advantage in anticipating enemy attacks.

name: New Naval Tactics
description: Naval aviation and new technology are changing the face of naval warfare forever. We should ensure our textbooks are up to date with these new tactics.

name: Battlecruiser Efforts
description: Battlecruisers present a middle balance between heavy battleships and faster cruisers. We should ensure we have some in our navy.

name: Rely on the Coast Guard
description: Restoring the Coast Guard will ensure that trade moves smoothly, criminals are stopped at sea, and those in danger are rescued.

name: Naval Aviation
description: Naval aviation is the future of warfare on the high seas. We should ensure that our air designs are capable of being launched from carriers and destroying the enemy fleet without even endangering our own.

name: The WACs and WAVEs
description: Women can serve many auxiliary roles in the navy, freeing up men for combat duty. While this might be socially controversial, it will significantly help the war effort.

name: Hawaiian Marines
description: Semper Fidelis means 'always loyal'. The loyal Marine Corps of Pearl Harbor will always be a bastion of American liberty and democracy, and help spread these freedoms around the world.

name: Jungle Training
description: Training our troops in the dense jungles of the Big Island and Maui will allow them to better repel any invasion by foreign powers.

name: Island Hopping
description: Should one of our islands fall to enemy attack, we need to train our troops on the best ways to conduct naval invasions to retake it, or assist our allies in any other naval invasions around the Pacific.

name: Kukini
description: In ancient Hawaii, Kukini were an elite class of men selected to undergo strenuous physical and mental training to become swift foot runners. Modern signal technology will allow us to better react to enemy movements and respond.

name: Expand Pearl Harbor
description: Pearl Harbor is an important naval port, and we should expand it to be more appealing to foreign alliances. They will be looking for a strategic port in the Pacific, and we have it.

name: Naval Industry
description: Our dockyards are somewhat inadequate to fight a war on their own. We need to ensure that new naval production facilities are constructed to support the war effort.

name: Rule the Islands
description: Following our extensive investments into naval research and construction, we have gained a place as one of the world's leading naval powers. Anchors away!

name: Hawaiian Air Force
description: Before the war, the American Army Air Corps had a presence in Hawaii. At the time it was little more than a branch of the Army. In this new war, we need to ensure it is independent and gets the support it needs.

name: New Pilot Training
description: Pilots are in short supply in the chaos of this war. We need to ensure that promising candidates aren't sent to the front lines, but instead given the proper training required to fight in the air.

name: Expand Midway
description: Midway island is an important stopping point for navies and air forces in the Pacific. Expanding the airfield there will give us extended power projection in the region.

name: Paratroopers
description: Paratroopers will allow us to rapidly attack otherwise isolated islands. We should start research into airborne doctrine and equipment at once.

name: Air Supremacy
description: The battle for the skies is fierce. We must promote vertical envelopment doctrine in order to protect our CAS and bombers.

name: Fighter Efforts
description: American fighter projects were halted during the 1920s, leading to a disadvantage in fighter development. We must close this gap in a new nation where naval aviation is essential to military success.

name: Battle-Field Support
description: The Army's request for more ground support while traversing the trenches our enemies have erected. As an equal partner the Air Force approves this request.

name: Bomber Efforts
description: Bombers, although a terror to behold, will enable us to project our power overseas. Our secret project also hinges on effective and safe bombers to deliver their secret payload.

name: Air Observer Corps
description: Ground observers are required for pilots to complete their missions. We should ensure that our ground troops have the correct equipment and training to call for air support effectively.

name: The WASPs
description: Women can fly a plane just as well as a man can, and can provide many valuable auxiliary tasks, freeing up men for other duties. While socially controversial, this will be an invaluable step in winning the war.

name: Expand Wake Island
description: Wake Island is another important airbase that will allow us even further power projection across the ocean.

name: Rule the Skies
description: We have triumphed over our foes, and now rule the skies of the central Pacific. Aim high, fly, fight, and win!
